title: Typographic Terminology
content:
Hello,   
   
here are a few **technical terms** I am coming across which, although I have a vague idea what most of them mean, it would be nice to get some definitive meanings for:   
   
Glyph   
Sidebearing   
Advance Width   
Black (width)   
Outlines (as opposed to glyphs)   
Bowl   
Counter   
   
I think that'll do for now. Can anyone help?
author: j75

comments.content:
Refer to the [Counterspace](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018132236/http:/counterspace.motivo.com/) website for definitions of most of the stuff on your list. . .   
   
Also, a glyph is another way to talk about the individual letters, numbers, symbols, etc. that comprise a font.   
   
Stuart :D
hmm... good site. what about Advance Width, Black Width and Sidebearing?

Check out the Measurements in the anatomy Section . . .
